intro: Thaumastochloa heteromorpha, commonly known as the variable thornstep, is a grass species native to tropical and subtropical regions of Asia. It is characterized by its slender, erect stems and narrow, linear leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. The plant produces small, spike-like inflorescences bearing tiny, wind-pollinated flowers. Its growth habit is typically clump-forming, and it thrives in well-drained soils. Thaumastochloa heteromorpha is often found in open woodlands and grasslands, where it contributes to the structural diversity of the vegetation.
